ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helped guide us through the early stages of our senior essays, from selecting a research subfield and topic through to making an outline and first draft of our senior essays.
I learned how to embark on a major research project, planning long-term and short-term goals and executing them along a time-line.

Very useful class (though required), biggest things gained by this course were: practice writing grad-school statements, ongoing structure and encouragement for thesis work that keeps you honest, a sense of what your classmates are up to and a corresponding sense of perspective on your own work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I appreciated the structure of this course, which forced us to stay on top of things and made the process of working on our senior essays less daunting. Overall, I am happy with the progress I made this semester, which would not have been possible without the weekly deadlines and progress updates we gave. I also appreciated the chance to learn from and give feedback to fellow classmates.

This class is the stepping stone to writing a year-long senior thesis, so the strength is that it got me significantly closer. I went from no topic or idea to having a full-fledged topic, research question, hypothesis, research, and more questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is required for Linguistics majors, but I appreciated it for keeping me on track in writing my senior essay.
Yes, you have to take it but also it's a joy to take.
